section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
goals__remit: The Belgian Brain Council (BBC) is a coordinating council formed by Belgian Universities, organisations in neurology, neurosurgery, psychiatry, basic brain research (neuroscience), patients organisations, pharmaceutical industries ans medical devices companies. It therefore represents a vast network of patients, doctors and scientists. These stakeholders make it eminently suited to work in close partnership with the Belgian Federal government, the members of the Parliament and the Belgian MEPs. The BBC was founded in 2005 and has office in Brussels.
relevant_communication: Cost estimates of brain disorders in Belgium (2006 publication), Consensus document on European Brain Research (2016 document), Belgian Brain Awareness Week (annual events), Biennal Congress (7th in 2018), Belgian Brain Ambassadors Day (conclusions doc with press release), Memorandum on 10 good reasons to invest in the brain, National Brain Plan
